description.narrative: In Ethiopia, women and girls experience chronic food insecurity and are subjected to violence, exploitation and marginalization, factors that are compounded by unequal access to formal education and a lack of productive assets, capital and ownership rights. The programme seeks to economically empower Ethiopian women by establishing women's self-help groups and business cooperatives; by ensuring access to microfinance and vocational training; and by creating partnerships with governmental and non-governmental organizations to provide women with business development services. The programme will improve the livelihoods of marginalized women and girls in Ethiopia, including nomadic Afar women, and will establish information and communications technology (ICT) centres and permanent networks among all relevant actors in each of the participating districts
